verbose_text: Several members of the nuclear receptor superfamily and their coactivators, in particular peroxisome proliferator activated receptors (PPARs), PPAR gamma coactivator 1 (PGC-1), and estrogen related receptors (ERRs), are known to play critical roles in controlling energy-metabolism-related transcription in cardiomyocytes.
evidence: activated receptors (PPARs), PPAR gamma coactivator 1 (PGC-1), and estrogen-related receptors (ERRs
